Variance.definition: a disagreement between two documents or positions ;esp

1.definition: a disagreement between two documents or positionsa disagreement between allegations (as in an indictment or complaint) and proof offered at trial that warrants an appropriate remedy (as a directed verdict or an acquittal) when prejudicial to the substantial rights of the defendant

2.definition: an authorization to do something contrary to the usual restriction [a granted by a state agency]permission for a use of real property that is prohibited by a zoning ordinance see alsocompare
